com.paypal.merchant.sdk

Interface TransactionManager


  • public interface TransactionManager
    Used to take payments, collect money, and process refunds.

    There are two main ways to collect payment ...
    1) for a simple fixed amount
    2) for an itemized list of items

    TransactionManager is stateful. It attempts to take a payment on the shopping cart it is holding and will work
    in concert with the CardReaderManager to emit events the UI may need to respond to while taking payment. It will
    emit these events to any TransactionListener that is registered with it.

    Some Examples:


    Example of how to take a payment for a simple fixed amount. This takes a payment for 42.50 in
    the Merchant's default currency
    transactionManager.beginPayment(new BigDecimal("42.50"));
    //Wait for the user swipe data to arrive then ...
    transactionManager.processPaymentWithSDKUI(PaymentType.CARD_READER, mResponseHandler);

    Example of how to take a payment for an itemized list of items.
    ShoppingCart cart = transactionManager.beginPayment();
    cart.addItem(apples, 6);
    cart.addItem(juice, 1);
    cart.addItem(orange, 6);
    transactionManager.setShoppingCart(cart);
    //Wait for the user swipe data to arrive then ...
    transactionManager.finalizePayment(PaymentType.CARD_READER, mResponseHandler);

      The list of possible errors you can receive when taking a payment.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activateReaderForPayment()
      This api is used to activate the EMV reader to look for the payments (Can be contact or contact less)
      void authorizePayment(TransactionManager.PaymentType paymentType, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
      Used to authorize a payment.
      Invoice beginPayment(BigDecimal amount, TransactionController transactionController)
      Let's you start a payment for a fixed amount.

      This call will:

      - Cause TransactionManager's shopping cart to be setup to contain a single item with a fixed amount equal to the 'amount' parameter.
      - If a card reader is attached we will start scanning for card swipes.

      Normal payment flow is as follows...
      1) call beginPayment() or beginPayment(amount)
      2) The user can then swipe a card (if paying by card)
      3) You can also optionally do things like:
      - set the Invoice
      - set TransactionExtras
      - set the tip
      - set the Signature.
      void beginPayment(Invoice invoice, TransactionController controller)
      Yet another configuration supported by the transaction manager to begin a payment operation.
      Invoice beginPayment(TransactionController transactionController)
      Let's you start an itemized payment

      This call will:

      - Cause TransactionManager to be setup with an empty Invoice
      - If a card reader is attached we will start scanning for card swipes.

      Normal payment flow is as follows...
      1) call beginPayment() or beginPayment(amount)
      2) The user can then swipe a card (if paying by card)
      3) You can also optionally do things like:
      - set the Invoice
      - set TransactionExtras
      - set the tip
      - set the Signature.
      void beginRefund()
      This function will be used as starting point to start the refund.
      void beginRefund(TransactionRecord record, TransactionController controller)
      This functin will be used as starting point to start the refund
      PPError<TransactionManager.CancelPaymentErrors> cancelPayment()
      Call cancelPayment to cancel the current payment.

      What this call does is:
      - Moves the TransactionManager into an idle state.
      - Causes the TransactionManager to forget any Invoice, Signature, card data, or TransactionExtras data it may have been holding.
      - Stops scanning for card swipes (if a card reader is connected).

      Note, it is only legal to issue a cancelPayment between calls to beginPayment and processPaymentWithSDKUI.
      That is because we can't cancel a payment before we begin it and we cannot cancel a payment
      once told to collect the funds (processPaymentWithSDKUI).
      void capturePayment(TransactionRecord record, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
      Used to capture an already authorized payment and therefore, completing the transaction.
      void checkRefundEligibility(SecureCreditCard cardData, TransactionRecord historicalPayment, DefaultResponseHandler<Boolean,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
      Check the refund eligibility for the current card with the given historical payment
      void deActivateReaderForPayment()
      This api is used to stop the EMV reader to look for payments.
      void doCashOrCheckRefund(String invoiceId, DefaultResponseHandler<InvoiceStatus,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
      Refund API call for Cash or Check Invoices.
      void doRefund(TransactionRecord record, BigDecimal amount, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionRecord,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
      For the near term this will return a failure when using oauth.
      void finalizePayment(TransactionRecord record, android.graphics.Bitmap signature, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
      Used to capture the signature of the customer if it already hasn't been captured in the processPaymentWithSDKUI call and complete the transaction.
      In case of EMV related payments, this API should be used after the processPaymentWithSDKUI call has been approved by the terminal.

      void processPayment(SecureCreditCard cardData, TransactionController customController, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
      Used to capture money from a customer using the supplied card data.

      You can pass in a ManualEntryCardData object (derived from SecureCreditCard) to supply
      unencrypted card data that was manually entered (via the UI), or scanned, etc.

      You can also pass in the SecureCreditCard data the CardReaderListener's onCardReadSuccess API
      might have sent you when a customer scanned their card.

      The current shopping cart will be used.

      This method can only be called after a call to processPaymentWithSDKUI()
      void processPayment(TransactionManager.PaymentType paymentType, TransactionController customController, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
      Collects money from a customer using the current PayPal Invoice.

      Used to process the Payment by showing the appropriate UI showing the intermediate progress states during the transaction

      This method can only be called after the call to any one flavor of beginPayment().

      Used to void/cancel an active payment or transaction.
      In case of EMV related payments, lets say a chip & signature flow, if the merchant decides to cancel the transaction while on signature screen, the app would call this API to void the transaction that has taken place.

      Once the transaction has been successfully canceled, appropriate TransactionListener events would be called.

    • Method Detail

      • setCardReaderMonitor

        void setCardReaderMonitor(boolean auto)
        Configure the TransactionManager to start and stop listening for card swipes while performing a transaction. By default, the TransactionManager performs this action but, if the application would like to take control of this, set the boolean param to false. This would expect the application to make use of CardReaderManager's WaitForAuthorization and CancelWaitForAuthorization APIs to start and stop listening for card swipes.
        Parameters:
        auto - pass false if the application would like to make use of the CardReaderManager's API to start and stop listening for card swipes. Pass true if the apps wants the SDK (TransactionManager) to automatically start and stop listening for card swipes. This is the default behavior.

      • getIgnoreHardwareReaders

        boolean getIgnoreHardwareReaders()
        Discovers if TransactionManager is configured to ignore or work with attached payment readers.
        Returns:
        Returns true if we'll ignore payment readers during TransactionManager's payment processing. False otherwise.

      • setIgnoreHardwareReaders

        void setIgnoreHardwareReaders(boolean ignore)
        Configure the TransactionManager to ignore OR work with any payment readers that might be attached.

        The default behavior is for the TransactionManager to work with attached payment readers. If that is the desired behavior there is no need to call this method.

        It is not legal to call this method during a transaction. Complete your transaction first, then change this setting. Calling setIgnoreHardwareReaders during a transaction will have no effect.

        Parameters:
        ignore - pass true to ignore readers, false to include them

      • isProcessingAPayment

        boolean isProcessingAPayment()
        Discover if we're busy processing a payment we the back end.
        Returns:
        a boolean value. Returns true if we're currently processing a finalizePayment

      • hasActiveTransaction

        boolean hasActiveTransaction()
        Discover if we're currently handling a transaction. While handling a transaction we can accept a shopping cart, TransactionExtras, and can finalizePayment. If configured to work with the hardware scanners (the default) we will also be scanning for card swipes.
        Returns:
        a boolean value. Returns true if we're currently handling a transaction.

      • registerListener

        void registerListener(TransactionListener observer)
        Register your PaymentListener to receive callbacks related to payment activities.
        Parameters:
        observer - your object which implements the PaymentListener interface

      • unregisterListener

        void unregisterListener(TransactionListener observer)
        Unregister your PaymentListener to stop receiving callbacks related to payment activities.
        Parameters:
        observer - your object which implements the PaymentListener interface

      • beginPayment

        Invoice beginPayment(BigDecimal amount,
                     TransactionController transactionController)
        Let's you start a payment for a fixed amount.

        This call will:

        - Cause TransactionManager's shopping cart to be setup to contain a single item with a fixed amount equal to the 'amount' parameter.
        - If a card reader is attached we will start scanning for card swipes.

        Normal payment flow is as follows...
        1) call beginPayment() or beginPayment(amount)
        2) The user can then swipe a card (if paying by card)
        3) You can also optionally do things like:
        - set the Invoice
        - set TransactionExtras
        - set the tip
        - set the Signature.
        4) Then you attempt to collect payment using one of the finalizePayment methods OR
        you can cancel the transaction with cancelPayment(). Both finalizePayment and
        cancelTransaction() cause us to stop scanning for card swipes.


        Note that you don't have to use this initial shopping cart, you can always provide
        a new shopping cart via the setShoppingCart(cart) method.

        Also, if not in 'transaction only mode', this call will start the hardware scanning
        for card swipes & card insertions.
        Parameters:
        amount - A BigDecimal indicating the amount to charge in units of the Merchant's default currency.
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of the initial shopping cart we're using for this transaction.
        If you make changes to the shopping cart (add a tip, or add items) make sure to apply your
        changes using the setShoppingCart call.

      • beginPayment

        Invoice beginPayment(TransactionController transactionController)
        Let's you start an itemized payment

        This call will:

        - Cause TransactionManager to be setup with an empty Invoice
        - If a card reader is attached we will start scanning for card swipes.

        Normal payment flow is as follows...
        1) call beginPayment() or beginPayment(amount)
        2) The user can then swipe a card (if paying by card)
        3) You can also optionally do things like:
        - set the Invoice
        - set TransactionExtras
        - set the tip
        - set the Signature.
        4) Then you attempt to collect payment using one of the finalizePayment methods OR
        you can cancel the transaction with cancelPayment(). Both finalizePayment and
        cancelTransaction() cause us to stop scanning for card swipes.


        Note that you don't have to use this initial shopping cart returned by this method, you can always provide
        a new shopping cart via the setActiveInvoice(cart) method.

        Also, if not in 'transaction only mode', this call will start the hardware scanning
        for card swipes & card insertions.
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of the initial shopping cart we're using for this transaction.
        If you make changes to the shopping cart (add a tip, or add items) make sure to apply your
        changes using the setActiveInvoice call.

      • beginPayment

        void beginPayment(Invoice invoice,
                  TransactionController controller)
        Yet another configuration supported by the transaction manager to begin a payment operation. You can initiate the payment workflow with a previously created invoice object and use that to process the payment. This method is agnostic whether the payment is itemized or for a fixed item as that aspect depends on the number of items in the invoice.
        Parameters:
        invoice -

      • setTransactionController

        void setTransactionController(TransactionController controller)
        This function will set the transaction controller
        Parameters:
        controller - controller which will be used by transaction manager to communicate with the application

      • getActiveInvoice

        Invoice getActiveInvoice()

      • setActiveInvoice

        void setActiveInvoice(Invoice invoice)
        Supply a shopping cart for the TransactionManager to use during itemized payments.
        This will overwrite any previous shopping cart in the transaction manager. Note that we
        make a copy of the cart you set into the transaction manager. That means any changes you
        make to the shopping cart after you have called setActiveInvoice will not be see by the
        transaction manager and will not become part of the purchase unless you once again call setActiveInvoice

        Parameters:
        invoice - The Invoice to use for the current transaction.

      • hasCardData

        boolean hasCardData()
        Discover if the transaction manager has received card swipe data that it can use
        if you call finalizePayment(CARD_READER).

        Returns:
        returns true if we have swipe data, false if we do not.

      • getCardData

        SecureCreditCard getCardData()

      • setCardData

        void setCardData(SecureCreditCard card)

      • processPayment

        void processPayment(TransactionManager.PaymentType paymentType,
                    TransactionController customController,
                    DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Collects money from a customer using the current PayPal Invoice.
        For cash payments pass in 'CASH' as the payment type.
        For credit card payments, pass in CARD_READER. Etc.

        Your response handler will be called with an error if you attempt to take a payment
        with an empty shopping cart.

        For CARD_READER payments we'll use the most recently scanned credit card since beginTransaction() was called.

        This method can only be called after a call to beginPayment().

        Once you call this method you can no longer cancel the payment.

        Once your completion handler is called the transaction manager will return to an idle state awaiting the
        next call to beginPayment (or doRefund). Any Invoice, CreditCardInfo, or TransactionExtras which may
        have been set into the TransactionManager during the previous purchase will be forgotten and all state cleared.

        Parameters:
        paymentType - Specifies what kind of payment this is (CASH, CARD_READER, etc. See PaymentType)
        response - The callback handler. On Success it returns you a PaymentResponse object. If there's an
        error it returns a PPError. This is called asynchronously on the UI thread.

      • processPayment

        void processPayment(SecureCreditCard cardData,
                    TransactionController customController,
                    DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Used to capture money from a customer using the supplied card data.

        You can pass in a ManualEntryCardData object (derived from SecureCreditCard) to supply
        unencrypted card data that was manually entered (via the UI), or scanned, etc.

        You can also pass in the SecureCreditCard data the CardReaderListener's onCardReadSuccess API
        might have sent you when a customer scanned their card.

        The current shopping cart will be used.

        This method can only be called after a call to processPaymentWithSDKUI()
        Parameters:
        cardData - The remote card's info (card number, exp date, etc)
        response - The callback handler. On Success it returns you a PaymentResponse object. If there's an
        error it returns a PPError. This is called asynchronously on the UI thread.

      • processPayment

        void processPayment(CheckedInClient client,
                    TransactionController customController,
                    DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Used to capture money from a customer who is logged into your store via the PayPal Location system.

        This method can only be called after a call to beginPayment()

        Parameters:
        client - A CheckedInClient that describes a user 'checked in' to your store.
        response - @param response The callback handler. On Success it returns you a PaymentResponse object. If there's an
        error it returns a PPError. This is called asynchronously on the UI thread.

      • processPaymentWithSDKUI

        void processPaymentWithSDKUI(TransactionManager.PaymentType paymentType,
                             DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Used to process the Payment by showing the appropriate UI showing the intermediate progress states during the transaction

        This method can only be called after the call to any one flavor of beginPayment(). We use the invoice which is returned or set during beginPayment to process the transaction

        Parameters:
        paymentType - Specifies what kind of payment this is (CASH, CARD_READER, etc. See PaymentType)
        response - The callback handler called need to pass in.

      • showTapOrInsertCardDialogOnReader

                 TransactionController controller)

      • processRefund

        void processRefund(BigDecimal amount,
                   DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        This apid will perform the refund for the specified amount on the transaction record provided.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to refund
        response - A response object that will be called when the refund is complete. If successful you will
        be passed a new TransactionRecord for the refund. If the refund fails you will receive a
        PPError. This is called asynchronously on the UI thread.

      • processCashOrCheckRefund

        void processCashOrCheckRefund(BigDecimal grandTotal,
                              DefaultResponseHandler<InvoiceStatus,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)

      • doRefund

        void doRefund(TransactionRecord record,
              BigDecimal amount,
              DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionRecord,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        For the near term this will return a failure when using oauth. When using GMAPI
        login this will trigger a refund on the invoice described by the RefundDetails object.

        Parameters:
        record - A RefundDetails object which describes the refund that is being
        attempted. Contains the invoice, the amount we are attempting
        to refund, the transactionId, etc
        amount - The amount to refund
        response - A response object that will be called when the refund is complete. If successful you will
        be passed a new TransactionRecord for the refund. If the refund fails you will receive a
        PPError. This is called asynchronously on the UI thread.

      • doCashOrCheckRefund

        void doCashOrCheckRefund(String invoiceId,
                         DefaultResponseHandler<InvoiceStatus,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Refund API call for Cash or Check Invoices. Just marks the invoices as refunded. Money never changes hands.
        Parameters:
        invoiceId - id of the invoice to refund
        response - A response object that will be called when the refund is complete. If successful you will
        be passed a new InvoiceStatus for the refund. If the refund fails you will receive a
        PPError. This is called asynchronously on the UI thread.

      • checkRefundEligibility

        void checkRefundEligibility(SecureCreditCard cardData,
                            TransactionRecord historicalPayment,
                            DefaultResponseHandler<Boolean,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Check the refund eligibility for the current card with the given historical payment
        Parameters:
        cardData - An SecureCreditCard to check against the invoice for refund eligibility
        historicalPayment - Record of a payment from the past.
        response - A DefaultResponseHandler> response that is called async on the main app thread when we have results. This is on the UI thread.

      • cancelPayment

        PPError<TransactionManager.CancelPaymentErrors> cancelPayment()
        Call cancelPayment to cancel the current payment.

        What this call does is:
        - Moves the TransactionManager into an idle state.
        - Causes the TransactionManager to forget any Invoice, Signature, card data, or TransactionExtras data it may have been holding.
        - Stops scanning for card swipes (if a card reader is connected).

        Note, it is only legal to issue a cancelPayment between calls to beginPayment and processPaymentWithSDKUI.
        That is because we can't cancel a payment before we begin it and we cannot cancel a payment
        once told to collect the funds (processPaymentWithSDKUI). Calling cancelPayment outside of those
        bounds will cause a non-successful PPError to be returned AND the above listed actions not to be performed.

        Returns:
        Returns a PPError indicating if the cancel was successful or not.

      • serializeTransactionRecord

        String serializeTransactionRecord(TransactionRecord record)
        Serialize the TransactionRecord into a String.

        This method is a utility to serialize a TransactionRecord object into a string. There is an equivalent deserialize
        to reconstruct a TransactionRecord from the serialized string
        Note that applications are not forced to use this API for serialization and deserialization. Should the app wish
        it can handle serialization on its own

        Parameters:
        record - - the TransactionRecord object that we want to serialize into a String. This implementation will
        return null if the input record is also null

        Returns:
        String representing the serialized TransactionRecord object. The app can then store it in its database for persistent
        storage

      • reconstructTransactionRecord

        TransactionRecord reconstructTransactionRecord(String serializedTransactionRecord)
        deserialize the TransactionRecord from a given String

        This method is a utility method to help with reconstructing a TransactionRecord based on a String that represents
        a previously serialized TransactionRecord.
        TransactionRecords are artifacts that the SDK emits to the app in response to payment requests. Applications might
        find it useful to be able to save off this record to persistent storage and being able to reconstruct the object later
        For example, a TransactionRecord is returned when a payment is successful and it needs to be used later when a refund
        needs to be processed. In this case, the app might just want to persistently store all successfully transaction records
        so that they can be retrieved later

        Parameters:
        serializedTransactionRecord - - a String that represents a previously serialized TransactionRecord
        Returns:
        TransactionRecord - a TransactionRecord object reconstructed from the serialized String

      • finalizePayment

        void finalizePayment(TransactionRecord record,
                     android.graphics.Bitmap signature,
                     DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Used to capture the signature of the customer if it already hasn't been captured in the processPaymentWithSDKUI call and complete the transaction.
        In case of EMV related payments, this API should be used after the processPaymentWithSDKUI call has been approved by the terminal. If the terminal declines, the transaction would be voided.
        Parameters:
        record - : The transaction record object that is returned back from the processPaymentWithSDKUI call.
        signature - : A bitmap signature of the customer.
        response - : A response handler that would be invoked by the SDK in case of a success or a failure.

      • voidActivePayment

        void voidActivePayment()
        Used to void/cancel an active payment or transaction.
        In case of EMV related payments, lets say a chip & signature flow, if the merchant decides to cancel the transaction while on signature screen, the app would call this API to void the transaction that has taken place.

        Once the transaction has been successfully canceled, appropriate TransactionListener events would be called.

      • sendReceipt

        void sendReceipt(TransactionRecord record,
                 String sendTo,
                 TransactionManager.SendReceiptTransactionType transactionType,
                 DefaultResponseHandler<Boolean,PPError<TransactionManager.SendReceiptErrors>> response)
        Used to send the receipt of a transaction to a customer based on the email address or the phone number provided.
        Parameters:
        record - : The transaction record object that is returned back from the processPaymentWithSDKUI call. This will contain all the necessary information required such as the invoice id, transaction id etc needed to send the receipt. Use this API when the transaction record is available. For example, when the transaction is successful.
        sendTo - : A string either containing the email address or the phone number of the recipient.
        response - : A response handler that would be invoked by the SDK in case of a success or a failure.

      • sendReceipt

        void sendReceipt(Invoice invoice,
                 String sendTo,
                 TransactionManager.SendReceiptTransactionType transactionType,
                 DefaultResponseHandler<Boolean,PPError<TransactionManager.SendReceiptErrors>> response)
        Used to send the receipt of a transaction to a customer based on the email address or the phone number provided.
        Parameters:
        invoice - : The invoice object that is obtained while calling beginPayment, which would also contain the invoice id needed to send the receipt. Use this API when there is no transaction record available. For example, in case of a transaction declined or cancel.
        sendTo - : A string either containing the email address or the phone number of the recipient.
        response - : A response handler that would be invoked by the SDK in case of a success or a failure.

      • initiateEMVTransaction

        void initiateEMVTransaction(BigDecimal amount,
                            Currency currency,
                            TransactionManager.InitiateTransactionEnum type,
                            boolean isContactLessTransaction)
        This method is to be called by the application prior to calling the authorize payment or refund payment, while taking EMV related payments. Invoking this method ensures that the correct amount is sent to EMV terminal before the user starts entering the pin.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount to be charged or refunded (based on the operation being performed)
        currency - currency to be used for the transaction
        type - pass in 'Sale' for taking a payment else 'Refund' in order to perform refund on a prior sale

      • authorizePayment

        void authorizePayment(TransactionManager.PaymentType paymentType,
                      DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Used to authorize a payment. The application would first need to invoke beginPayment, insert line items within the shopping cart/invoice and ask the customer to swipe their card. Once the above is completed, invoke this API to perform an authorization on the invoice.
        Parameters:
        paymentType - Specifies what kind of payment this is.
        response - : A response handler that would be invoked by the SDK in case of a success or a failure.

      • capturePayment

        void capturePayment(TransactionRecord record,
                    DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Used to capture an already authorized payment and therefore, completing the transaction.
        Parameters:
        record - : The transaction record that is obtained while performing the authorization by calling the processPaymentWithSDKUI API. The transaction number within the record is then used to capture the payment.
        response - : A response handler that would be invoked by the SDK in case of a success or a failure.

      • voidAuthorization

        void voidAuthorization(TransactionRecord record,
                       DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse,PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>> response)
        Used to void an authorized payment.
        Parameters:
        record - : The transaction record that is obtained while performing the authorization by calling the processPaymentWithSDKUI API. The transaction number within the record is then used to void the payment.
        response - : A response handler that would be invoked by the SDK in case of a success or a failure.

      • activateReaderForPayment

        void activateReaderForPayment()
        This api is used to activate the EMV reader to look for the payments (Can be contact or contact less)

      • deActivateReaderForPayment

        void deActivateReaderForPayment()
        This api is used to stop the EMV reader to look for payments.
